original: Bergengren, Edvard Amandus, f. d. provinsialläkare, Kalmar, f. 25/9/83 i Älmhult, Kronob. 1., av kamr. Carl Edvard B. o. Emma Kristina Johansson. G. 19 m. Lisa Elfrida Johanson. translated: Bergengren, Edvard Amandus, former district physician, Kalmar, born September 25th, 1883 in Älmhult, Kronoberg County, son of comrade Carl Edvard B. and Emma Kristina Johansson. Married in 19xx to Lisa Elfrida Johanson. Children: Eivor Lisa Kristina b. 1920, d. 1938, Edvard Karl Gustaf b. 1923, d. same year, Ulla Lisa and Inga Lisa b. 1925. Graduated from Mogiex in Västerås in 1903, medical degree in 1907 and licensed in 1914 in Stockholm. Participated in several advanced courses and congresses in Sweden, Denmark, and Finland. Military doctor's scholarship in the Reserve in 1909, in the field corps in 1912, battalion doctor's in the Reserve from 1915-1918, several military medical positions from 1909-1918, various positions as acting and district physician from 1910-1922, district physician in Orust's district from 1915-1917, district physician in Tanum from 1917-1922, in Molkom's district from 1922-1935 and in Kalmar's district from 1935-1946, retired with a pension last year, and assistant first district physician in Kalmar County from 1945-1947, dispenser physician in Orust from 1915-1917, in Tanum from 1917-1922 and in Molkom from 1922-1935, railway physician at Bergslag Enskilda Järnväg from 1922-1935, physician at Nyed's psychiatric hospital from 1926-1935, at Nyed's sanatorium for chronic patients from 1930-1935, at Rockneby's private maternity hospital from 1935-1946, and at the maternity and child welfare station in Kalmar County from 1941-1946. Member of the health board in Nyed from 1924-1935 and of the child welfare board there from 1925-1935. Chairman of the Värmli healthcare association in 1929, member of the Swedish Medical Association since 1918, board member of the Kalmar County Medical Association since 1946, and Motorist Men's National Association. Hobby: car riding. RNO.
